9ae45c80f0468dc96c7b20d0afc3055f344c8203a0c9258239f350b9f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://26e8b38a7ac8e7b4463af00cf7fff1bf48ae9875765bf4f7751e100124d0bc8c","dweb:/ipfs/QmWcsmkVr24xmmjfnBQZoemFniXjj3vwT78Cz6uqZW1Hux"]},"dependencies/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts@4.3.2/contracts/utils/Strings.sol":{"keccak256":"0x391d3ba97ab6856a16b225d6ee29617ad15ff00db70f3b4df1ab5ea33aa47c9d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://d636ba90bbbeed04a1ea7fe9ec2466757e30fd38ba2ca173636dbf69a518735e","dweb:/ipfs/QmQwCB2BHnEuYR22PYt9HkpbgeFDhq4rHmaYqAZbX3WRC7"]},"dependencies/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts@4.3.2/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5718c5df9bd67ac68a796961df938821bb5dc0cd4c6118d77e9145afb187409b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://d10e1d9b26042424789246603906ad06143bf9a928f4e99de8b5e3bdc662f549","dweb:/ipfs/Qmejonoaj5MLekPus229rJQHcC6E9dz2xorjHJR84fMfmn"]},"dependencies/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts@4.3.2/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa28007762d9da9db878dd421960c8cb9a10471f47ab5c1b3309bfe48e9e79ff4","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://796ab6e88af7bf0e78def0f059310c903af6a312b565344e0ff524a0f26e81c6","dweb:/ipfs/QmcsVgLgzWdor3UnAztUkXKNGcysm1MPneWksF72AvnwBx"]}},"version":1}

params._setLimitParametersRoleHolders: List of addresses which will     be granted with role SET_LIMIT_PARAMETERS_ROLE
params._updateSpentAmountRoleHolders: List of addresses which will     be granted with role UPDATE_SPENT_AMOUNT_ROLE

returns._0: limit - the maximum that can be spent in a period
returns._1: periodDurationMonths - length of period in months

returns._alreadySpentAmount: - amount already spent in the current period
returns._periodEndTimestamp: - end date of the current period
returns._periodStartTimestamp: - start date of the current period
returns._spendableBalanceInPeriod: - balance available for spending in the current period

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

isUnderSpendableBalance(uint256,uint256).details: note that upfront check is used to compare _paymentSum with total limit in case when motion is started in one period and will be probably enacted in the next.

params._motionDuration: Motion duration - minimal time required to pass before enacting of motion

returns._0: True if _payoutAmount is less or equal than may be spent

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._periodDurationMonths: Length of period in months. Must be 1, 2, 3, 6 or 12.

returns._0: Balance that can be spent in the current period

getPeriodState().notice: Returns state of the current period: amount spent, balance available for spending,start date of the current period and end date of the current periodIf period advanced and the period was not shifted,then the method will return spendable balance corresponding to the previous period.

isUnderSpendableBalance(uint256,uint256).notice: Checks if _payoutAmount is less or equal than the may be spent

setLimitParameters(uint256,uint256).notice: Sets periodDurationMonths and limitCalculates currentPeriodEndTimestamp as a calendar date of the beginning of next period.

spendableBalance().notice: Returns balance that can be spent in the current periodIf period advanced and no call to updateSpentAmount or setLimitParameters made,then the method will return spendable balance corresponding to the previous period.

updateSpentAmount(uint256).notice: Checks if _payoutAmount may be spent and increases spentAmount by _payoutAmount.Also updates the period boundaries if necessary.

documentation.text: @notice The maximum that can be spent in a period
@notice Amount already spent in the period

statements.documentation:
When it is necessary to shift the currentPeriodEndTimestamp it takes on a new value.
 And also spent is set to zero. Thus begins a new period.

documentation.text:
@notice Checks if _payoutAmount may be spent and increases spentAmount by _payoutAmount.
 @notice Also updates the period boundaries if necessary.

statements.documentation: set spent to _limit if it's greater to avoid math underflow error

documentation.text:
@author zuzueeka
 @notice Stores limits params and provides limit-enforcement logic
  spendableBalance = limit-spentAmount
 |
              |................              |..               limit-spentAmount = limit-0 = limit
 .....        |                ...           |
      ........|                   ......     |  ..............
               |                         .....|
 > Time
 |     ^       |                ^  ^     ^    |  ^              (^ - Motion enactment)
              |currentPeriodEndTimestamp     |currentPeriodEndTimestamp
 |             |spentAmount=0                 |spentAmount=0
 currentPeriodEndTimestamp is calculated as a calendar date of the beginning of
 a next month, bi-months, quarter, half year, or year period.
 If, for example, periodDurationMonths = 3, then it is considered that the date changes once a quarter.
 And currentPeriodEndTimestamp can take values 1 Apr, 1 Jul, 1 Oct, 1 Jan.
 If periodDurationMonths = 1, then shift of currentPeriodEndTimestamp occurs once a month
 and currentPeriodEndTimestamp can take values 1 Feb, 1 Mar, 1 Apr, etc
